reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Beautiful Day sets itself on a path to make a unique game.  It is an early access survival game, which are absolutely a dime a dozen, but ABD is trying a different route.   It is an MMORTS in the same vain as Age of Empires.   Definitely caught my attention when my friend mentioned it to me yesterday.

The devs are even kind enough to give you a free key if you are a current/former military vet.   I was lucky enough to receive a key, not just because of the dev's generosity (for which I am thankful for) but also it saved me spending $17.99 on this game."

Truly
date: early access can be a very useful tool for developers to polish their product and make necessary changes that the player base would like.  However
hoursPlayed: there is a time and a place to utilize it.\n\nSimply put
voteText: A Beautiful Day is anything but beautiful for the time being.  It just isn't ready for even early access in my opinion.\n\nYou maybe thinking
helpfulPercent: "you've only played this game for less than an hour.  How does your opinion matter?"  True
votesHelpful: very true.  In the first 5 minutes the game has crashed a multiple of times.  Not an issue
votesTotal: bugs pop up with different systems naturally.  It isn't just that though.  The text in the game is extremely low res and hard to read.  The game skips past the starting menu screen and even bypasses your choice for race.  It literally throws you in an empty forest with other players.  All named "Jeff".   I couldn't cut down trees because I didn't have an axe and I couldn't attack players because I didn't have a weapon.  I couldn't interact with the interaction box nor read anything for the resource bar.  I could just right click move around at other Jeffs and listen to the very loud music/footsteps (hit escape and the game closes and the menu button doesn't do anything.)\n\nNormally
votesFunny:
I would write this game off as a complete sham but the developers are nice and do seem to want to make a solid game.   They had stated that they will be patching the game quite a lot so let's see if they can turn this around.

I will give the developers the benefit of the doubt and check on the game and progress if it is made I will reevaluate my review and recommend it if it is fun and playable.   For now?  Don't spend your money.

Edit: 8/17/15-  A couple of patches have been put out.  I can now choose what race I want to play as but unfortunately can't move.    Still
commentsCount: the devs seem to be working on fixing the issues.  Will keep this updated :)"
column19: 112 of 129 people (87%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Reviewing the game as it currently is...not what everyone saying it will be in a day/week/year from now. Will update review after game updates.

(08/16/15) Simply put, the game is unplayable for me. Too many threads apparently. The sound glitchs out. And while this might just be me, it turns my internet off. I tested it 10 times and every single time it crashs my internet turns off for a min.

(08/17/15) The devs are trying to fix the problems now. Going to wait for the big announcement. (5:00) A small update just came out makeing the game playable. Still broken tho. (5:40) Another update. Can't tell what was changed. Lost my dude 5 mins in since the last update. Runs better in windowed mode. (6:15) I found a way to find my guy in the forums. Have 3 fps. (8:45) Can't connect. (9:25) Down for maintenance. The Devs are looking for for a second programmer.

(08/18/15) After another update the game has become playable. It runs some what smoothly, has really bad pop in, glitchy, and don't have any in game options yet. But it only been here for a week or so so I'll forgive it...for now.

(08/19/15) Another day of updates. Seems to run better now, very little lag. Still has pop in. Still have trouble connecting. A new glitch today, I don't spawn and neither do everyone else. Just a big map to explore. When I could play I could not gather anything. Good news is the devs has like 2-3 programmers now, so they should be able to fix bugs around the clock. Still not gonna recommend the game till it's stable and enjoyable tho.

(08/21/15) A big update today. Apparently something going to happen this halloween, on the main menu it shows some kids eating a pumpkin stickman monster. Also the game won't just automatically shove you into the game anymore. Had to choose a faction again, last time I picked the first one, this time I picked the second one. Stayed passive. After it was done loading, everything pop up almost instantly. Still very little lag, was not stuck. After walking around a bit, I tried searching for stuff, but it must have glitched, because after standing still for 3 mins I was not getting anything. You HAVE to search at the begining of the game to get anything. Seeing a new logout button on the top, I hope that would put me back in the main menu, then click play, and that would fix the glitch. Nope. Closes the game. After I tried to get back in it was just the connecting" thing forever. It feels like I can only play this game 1 time per day

Early Access Review

The game is currently unplayable and not even suitable for early access release screenshots are nothing like what they are in game. I replied to a thread to explain that the game was not suitable for early access release i get a childish reply from the developers who then proceed to ban me off the forums. It's shame the game has potetional to be a unique game that has not been made before on this scale but the way the devs reply back to you just puts me off supporting this game all together. I would avoid paying for this game for the time being untill the devs learn some better customer support skills.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This slow motion train wreck just keeps getting worse.  I searched Steam for ABD and saw that it was listed as a free demo.  I clicked on the box hoping to give them (devs) another chance, but was just sent to the purchase page.  This fiasco should serve as a notice to others who might want to bring a product to market that is untested - don't do it.  If it were my product I would take it down, fix it, rename it and rebrand it.

Added April 2, 2016.  Friends, do not contribute to this scam.  This has been a series of execuses that are beyond rational belief.  How Steam allows this to continue is beyond me, as it is so bad that it is smear on their reputation as well.  If you purchased this game and have not requested a refund you should, even if the refund period has elapsed.

I have watched with astonishment now for months, just to see how long it would take for Steam to pull this insult to the industry from their virtual shelves.   If you ever see another product from this scam artist run for the hills.
voteText: 13 of 18 people (72%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Edited Review:

I originally had a positive review for this because of my faith in the devs. However after many promises broken, after the harsh and belittling comments from the main dev, and after spending more time time announcing season updates before the game was even playable, I had to update my review to negative.

- Yes launch was sabotaged by their old programmer I get that, but with their new programmer, many deadlines were given but never met. If you're unsure then do not give us a date.

-if you skim through discussions or even other negative reviews you will find the lead developer cursing out, making fun of others, making threats, etc., people but turning around and banning the people for cursing back at the devs. It's hypocritical and uncalled for.

-Up until the last beta update the game wasn't even playable, now the game only allows you to log in and move around. It has almost no core features.  Yet, while the game wasn't playable, the lead dev continued announcing that he was working on Halloween updates along with other seasonal updates. Um, why? If you're game isn't playable at all, focus your time in effort on getting it to work and not on extra features you want it to have.

I will update if and when ABD becomes playable.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've gotten to play this game for maybe a total of 45 minutes since I purchased it, but from what I've tinkered with it is very promising. Leaving a bad review just because the servers haven't been up and/or bugs is foolish. The developers are very active, working diligently and always keeping the community updated via forums/chat. If you would like to support a sincere dev team that is trying to build a lasting, innovative game, then don't hesitate!

I have nothing against these Developers, they had a rocky start. The game isnt perfect no game ever is. that said I am eager to try out the new future blds and pass on the game to friends. I don't think I was treated fairly in the forums as I have said I only said 1 thing 1 time that the Develpers didnt like and got banned. I understand the need to not have negative people bash your game but censoring those people only makes them seem right, and in my opinion i was right I only asked the developer to be a responsible buisness owner and instead of giving weekly updates of updates that never come just tell us straightup hey this is my first time doing this entirely  got screwed over because i didnt make sure he was doing what i paid him too move on and give us a definitve release date even a single payer build :D,  But thats not for me to say All I could do is give my honest opinion even if the Developer had said there wont be a playable version for mre then a few months that would be fine with me, i purchased a game that was devloped by 2 devlopers over the course of 7 years, its not a fantastic game but they tried and so are these devlopers thats what counts to me. I realy hope the devlopers get the exposure that this game deserves and I really hope it can become the game that everyones wants to see and play, once again f you dont want to support devlopers then dont get it if your a person that understands ambitions and dreams then by all means by in because ts gonna be a great game if all the kinks can be worked out.

:EDIT: due to financial constraints the devlopers have had to put this title on hold, so if you want to support them by al means support them but if you want a game that works and is fully complete then save your money for now and get something else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

AN ABD: A Beautiful Day Review (WILL BE UPDATED CONSTANTLY)
Hey guys, my name is Seraphis. I do not have any game time, but I wanted to go ahead and do a review on more of the project and the team as apposed to actual gameplay at this point. I will go ahead and update this as I play the game and make sure to keep you all informed as I do.

Okay so when I first saw this game on steam early access I was excited. When seeing their store page I was slightly concerned due to the negative reviews and like a lot of people instead of just moving on I wanted to learn more of why this game was seeing a lot of negative light.

This game had a really rough launch, the game was completely unstable and not playable and eventually it lead to the devs having to bring it down. I sympathize with everyone here who's butt hurt and upset about all this, but lets be real for a second and think about the situation. Steam early access by definition means the game is not complete. With that said there's absolutely no reason for the negative reviews. I like to look at early access as you're donating" your money to back a project
date: similar to what you'd do on a kick starter. Okay
recommended:
so with that out of the way I want to talk about the positives and why I "backed / bought" this game.

WILL UPDATE THIS SECTION AS NEEDED!
Pros:
Very friendly and active community
Busy hard working development team
Can talk with devs in group chat
Constant updates and fast response timeCons:

So far I really don't have any until I actually get into the game. This will be sometimes tomorrow Friday the 4th

Okay so I'm not trying to convince anyone to buy this yet. But if you're interested in learning more you can add me or just hop in the ABD group chat. Devs are in there all the time willing to ask any questions along with other fans like myself who have backed the game. And as I said I will be updating this as I go.

~Seraphis"
